introduction: Meem Sakinah is the letter Meem (م) with a sukoon (مْ). It has three rules depending on the letter that follows it.

rules.description: When Meem Sakinah is followed by Baa (ب), the Meem is hidden with a light nasal sound (ghunnah) for 2 beats. The lips come close together but do not fully press.

examples.rule_applied: Ikhfaa Shafawi — Meem Sakinah followed by Baa (ب)
Ikhfaa Shafawi — Meem Sakinah followed by Baa (ب)

rules.description: When Meem Sakinah is followed by another Meem (م), the two Meems merge into one emphasized Meem with ghunnah for 2 beats. Also called Idgham Mithlayn Sagheer.

examples.rule_applied: Idgham Shafawi — Meem Sakinah followed by Meem (م)
Idgham Shafawi — Meem Sakinah followed by Meem (م)

rules.description: When Meem Sakinah is followed by any letter OTHER than Baa (ب) or Meem (م), the Meem is pronounced clearly without ghunnah. This covers the remaining 26 letters.
rules.letters_description: All Arabic letters except ب and م

examples.rule_applied: Izhar Shafawi — Meem Sakinah followed by Faa (ف)
Izhar Shafawi — Meem Sakinah followed by Taa (ت) within one word

common_mistakes: Adding ghunnah when followed by Waw (و) or Faa (ف) — only Baa triggers Ikhfaa
Not closing lips fully when pronouncing the clear Meem before opening for the next letter
